intro: Aerva aegyptiaca, commonly known as Egyptian spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats. Aerva aegyptiaca is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
